tool.name: miRNAPredict
tool.command:
#if $atype.grouptype == "preprocess": bash ${__tool_directory__}/scripts/srnaProcess.sh -f ${__tool_directory__} #if $atype.sradata.datainput == "yes": -s $atype.sradata.srainput #end if #if $atype.userdata.datainput == "yes": -u $atype.userdata.userinput #end if #if $atype.adapterdata.adapterinput == "yes": -a $atype.adapterdata.adapter #end if -q $atype.qulity -m $atype.min -n $atype.max -c $atype.cleanRead -p $atype.athreads -g $outputFasta -i $QCres -l $rmdout #end if
#if $atype.grouptype == "identify": bash ${__tool_directory__}/scripts/mirProcess.sh --path ${__tool_directory__} --fasta $atype.fastaTarFile --species $atype.speciesPath #if $atype.alldata.filter == "no": --filter ${atype.alldata.sampleID} #end if --readnum $atype.readnum --min $atype.miRNAsMin --max $atype.miRNAsMax --map $atype.multiAlign --sum $atype.sumRPM --least $atype.leastRPM --samnum $atype.samnum --method ${atype.methods.identify} --thread $atype.bthreads --outxt $resultfile --outfasta $outfasta --outmap $outmap --expfile $expfile #end if

param.name: grouptype
param.label: The content you want to analyze

param.name: srainput
param.label: SRA accession number
param.help: Multiple names should be separated by comma or line break, e.g. SRR1042171, SRR9302978

param.name: adapterinput
param.label: Input adapters?
param.help: If no, adapters will be detected by miR156 sequence and dnapi

param.name: adapter
param.label: Adapters file
param.help: Each line contains one ID and adapter

param.name: cleanRead
param.label: Minimal read number for clean files

param.name: fastaTarFile
param.label: Input compressed fasta file (fasta.tar.gz)
param.help: Note: The compressed fasta file can be obtained from two ways -- upload or preprocess in miRNAPredict.

param.name: speciesPath
param.label: Input species (path)
param.help: Note: The input file contains the name of the species.

param.name: miRNAsMin
param.label: Minimal read length cut-off for miRNAs candidate

param.name: miRNAsMax
param.label: Maximum read length cut-off for miRNAs candidate

param.name: multiAlign
param.label: Set the alignment number per read

param.name: sumRPM
param.label: Set the threshold of total abundance of a read in all samples

param.name: leastRPM
param.label: Set the least value of maximum abundance of a read in all samples

param.name: samnum
param.label: Set the least samples of a read

data.name: outputFasta
data.label: The processed fasta data from dataProcessing

data.name: outmap
data.label: The location of sequences on the genome

tool.help:
|
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool consists of two sub-functions:
1. **Raw sequencing data preprocessing**: this sub-function will download and filter raw sRNA sequencing data automatically from NCBI SRA (Short Read Archive) database.
- The processed data can be directly used for sRNA quantification and identification.
2. Identification: this sub-function generates the quantified reads by the following steps:
1. The trimmed reads in limited length were aligned to the reference genome.
2. Reads matching known structural RNAs (rRNAs, tRNAs, snRNAs, and snoRNAs) were removed.
3. Read counts were normalized by millions of mapped reads (transcripts per million; TPM) in each library.
4. Low abundance reads were further filtered.
5. miRNA candidates were identified using `miRDP2`_ or `miRCat2`_.
.. class:: infomark
**Inputs**
For **Preprocessing**:
- SRA accessions or compressed raw fastq files - Adapter sequences for each library - The parameters of quality controls, such as quality score, minimum length, maximum length, and minimal read number.
For **Identification**:
- The compressed fasta files - Path of genome file - The parameters of miRNA identification, such as miRNAs length, multi-mapping, total abundance, maximum abundance, and sample support.
.. class:: infomark
**Output**
For **Preprocressing**:
- Clean fasta files - Quality report about public sRNA-seq data or private sequencing data
For **Identification**:
- GFF annotation file containing the information of pre-miRNAs and mature miRNAs. - An HTML document containing the sequences, structures, and expression of pre-miRNAs and mature miRNAs.
.. _`miRDP2`: http://srnaworld.com/miRDP2/index.html .. _`miRCat2`: http://srna-workbench.cmp.uea.ac.uk/mircat2/
|
